title: 111_hr476
content: The Act titled "Veterans, Women, Families with Children, and Persons With Disabilities Housing Fairness Act of 2010" allows for testing for discrimination. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will conduct a nationwide program to detect and document discriminatory practices in housing and mortgage lending markets based on race, color, religion, sex, familial status, disability status, or national origin. The program will be administered through agreements with fair housing enforcement organizations, and the Secretary will evaluate its effectiveness and report to Congress. The Secretary will evaluate the program's effectiveness and issue regulations for program applications. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will report to Congress biennially on testing outcomes and propose actions to address any issues raised. Results of testing may be used for enforcement actions by the Secretary, Federal agencies, State or local governments, or other entities under contract with the Secretary. The section defines terms like "disability status" and "familial status" and clarifies that it does not affect criminal law or the Truth in Lending Act. Regulations must be established within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must issue regulations within 180 days of the Act's enactment to establish minimum standards for tester training. $15,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2011 through 2015 to carry out these provisions. SEC. 3. Increase in funding for the Fair Housing Initiatives Program. Section 561 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 is amended to authorize appropriations of $42,500,000 for fiscal years 2011 through 2015. At least 75 percent of the funds are allocated for private enforcement initiatives, up to 10 percent for education and outreach programs, with the remaining amounts for other purposes. The amendment to Section 561 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 authorizes appropriations of $42,500,000 for fiscal years 2011 through 2015. Funds are allocated for private enforcement initiatives, education and outreach programs, and other authorized program activities. Amounts appropriated shall remain available until expended. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must establish minimum standards for training testers of organizations funded under this Act within 180 days. Regulations will be developed for evaluating testers and issued after public comment. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must establish minimum standards for training testers of organizations funded under this Act within 180 days. Regulations will be developed for evaluating testers and issued after public comment, following the procedure under section 553 of title 5, United States Code. Sense of Congress is for the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to comply with fair housing education and outreach programs, regulations, and obligations. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will implement a grant program to assist organizations in studying and addressing housing discrimination and segregation. Eligible organizations must submit an application and provide matching funds for the grant. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will require eligible organizations to provide matching funds for grants, meet fair housing enforcement organization requirements, and submit biennial reports to Congress on study results and recommendations for addressing issues raised. Authorization of Appropriations: $5,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2011 to 2015 to carry out the provisions of this section. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS: Prohibits the use of funds for political activities, advocacy, lobbying, travel for political purposes, or tax return advice.
